result.execSummary:
The defendant Harvey James Phillips II was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: GFE at FTE of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours community service per week.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by Department.  

Letter of apology to M.L. 

DNA sample. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Harvey James Phillips II

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 3:09 pm 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Def appears in person with Atty Gerald Hersil.   
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

PLEA: Ct. 1 (DC/Use of Dangerous Weapon)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 1 year probation - CONDITIONS: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; good faith effort at fulltime employment of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; no possession of dangerous weapons; letter of apology to ML; DNA sample/surcharge; CC. 
COURT finds the def entitled to NO days jail credit. 
Adj: 3:17 pm

Pre-trial conference on July 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Final pre-trial on August 1, 2022 at 03:10 pm.

No contact with victim(s):  M.L. Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.

State appears by ADA Kerri Puig.  Defendant appears in person, pro se.

Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel.

CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): M.L.
- No possession or use of dangerous weapons. 
- Prints and photograph.
